alert.note: Alert for Hitchcock; Red Willow (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 14 at 11:34PM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Red Willow and northeastern Hitchcock Counties through MIDNIGHT CDT... At 1134 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 6 miles north of Culbertson, or 12 miles northwest of McCook, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northwestern Red Willow and northeastern Hitchcock Counties. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
